summary:
Capital Change Notice Summary:

  • Performance Rights Issued: 164,657 (0.0739% dilution post-issue).
  • Terms:
  • Vesting tied to TSR (50%) and EPS (50%) performance hurdles over 3 years (2025–2028).
  • No exercise price; lapse if conditions unmet or employment ends.
  • Purpose: Long-term incentive for key executives.
  • Total Outstanding Performance Rights: 575,019.
  • Issue Date: 30 July 2025.

No material trading/capital markets impact beyond dilution.

Synlait Performance Update (FY25):
- FY25 Underlying EBITDA: $100M–$110M (vs. $45.2M in FY24); Underlying NPAT: breakeven (vs. -$60.4M in FY24).
- Reported Net Loss After Tax: -$27M to -$40M (vs. -$182.1M in FY24); Reported EBITDA: $50M–$68M (vs. -$4.1M in FY24).
- Manufacturing Issues: One-off costs at Dunsandel facility (now resolved).
- Target Closing Net Debt: $300M.
- Compliance: Banking covenants met.
- FY25 Results Date: 29 September 2025.

(Operational/financial update; no immediate trading actions triggered.)

EROAD FY25 Group Climate Statement Summary

Key Material Information for Capital Markets:

  1. Climate Reporting Compliance
  2. Second annual climate-related disclosure under Aotearoa New Zealand Climate Standards (aligned with FY25 Sustainability Report).

  3. Excludes Scope 3 "use of sold products" emissions (immaterial to overall footprint).

  4. Emissions Data (FY25 vs. FY23 Baseline)

  5. Scope 1 (Direct emissions): 152.5 tCO₂e (-9% vs. FY23).
  6. Scope 2 (Indirect energy emissions): 74.4 tCO₂e (-9% vs. FY23).
  7. Scope 3 (Indirect value chain emissions): 11,189 tCO₂e (-53% vs. FY23).
  8. Total emissions: 11,416 tCO₂e (-53% vs. FY23).

  9. Assurance: Independent verification by Toitū Envirocare (reasonable assurance for Scopes 1–2, limited for Scope 3).

  10. Targets

  11. Short-term: Achieved FY25 targets (4% reduction in Scope 1, 15% in Scope 2, intensity basis).
  12. Medium-term: 28% reduction in Scope 1 and 29% in Scope 2 by FY28 (intensity basis).

  13. Long-term:

    • 54.6% absolute reduction in Scopes 1–2 by 2033 (vs. FY23).
    • 61% reduction in emissions intensity per $1M revenue by 2033.
    • Net-zero commitment by 2050 (Scopes 1–3).

  14. Operational Highlights

  15. Reduced freight emissions via bulk shipping and rail use.
  16. 100% global e-waste recycling for returned hardware (up from NZ-only in FY24).

  17. Energy: Switched NZ electricity to 100% renewable provider (Ecotricity).

  18. Customer Impact

  19. Sustainability Module (launched FY24) used by 1,005 NZ customers for emissions tracking.
  20. AI dashcam ("Clarity Edge") reduced high-risk driving events, improving safety and fuel efficiency.

  21. Refrigerated fleet customers cut fuel use by 65% via temperature monitoring.

  22. Governance

  23. Board and Finance/Risk/Audit Committee oversee climate strategy.

  24. No material climate risks identified in FY25; integrated into enterprise risk framework.

  25. Transition Plan

  26. Focus areas: Decarbonizing operations, supply chain resilience, enabling customer decarbonization.
  27. FY26: Targets to be set for Scope 3 reductions and customer-focused metrics.

Conclusion: No immediate trading impact, but progress on emissions reductions and customer-facing sustainability tools may strengthen long-term value proposition. Disclosure aligns with NZ standards, though Scope 3 data gaps remain.

Next Steps: Monitor FY26 targets (Scope 3 expansion, customer emissions tracking).

No material operational or financial disruptions noted.

CEO Appointment Announcement:
- Key Change: Nikhil Ravishankar appointed as new CEO, effective 20 October 2025, succeeding Greg Foran.
- Background: Current Chief Digital Officer at Air NZ; emphasis on digital transformation and customer innovation.
- Market Implication: Leadership transition during industry challenges (climate, costs, geopolitics); no immediate financial impact disclosed.

No material trading or capital markets information identified (no capital/financial updates, guidance changes, or structural shifts).
